title: DUP statement in full: Why we can't support Boris' new Brexit deal
text:
Arlene Foster's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has doubled down on its pledge to vote down Boris Johnson's new Brexit deal.

The Prime Minister negotiated an eleventh-hour change to the papers ahead of Saturday's crucial vote, insisting it was a "great new deal".

But, once again, the DUP and the backstop look set to be the spanner in the works after officials confirmed they would not abstain from the vote - meaning they will be going against the Government.

It appears there are three key areas - customs, consent and VAT - which have still not been resolved, as far as Ms Foster is concerned.

Mr Johnson's new arrangement is not in "Northern Ireland’s long term interests", say the DUP. The Government's...
description: Arlene Foster's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has doubled down on its pledge to vote down Boris Johnson's new Brexit deal.
